articles.title: Definitions
articles.text:
As used in this chapter:
(1) "Affiliate" means a legal entity that controls, is controlled
by, or is under common control with another legal entity.
(2) "Biometric data" means data generated by automatic measurements
of an individual's biological characteristics, including a fingerprint,
a voiceprint, eye retinas, irises, or other unique biological patterns
or characteristics that are used to identify a specific individual.
(3) "Child" means an individual under the age of 13 years.
(4) "Consent" means a clear affirmative act signifying a consumer's
freely given, specific, informed, and unambiguous agreement to process
personal data relating to the consumer.
(5) "Consumer" means an individual who is a Utah resident acting in
an individual or household context.
(6) "Controller" means a person doing business in Utah that determines
the purposes and means for processing personal data.
(7) "De-identified data" means data that cannot reasonably be used to
infer information about, or otherwise be linked to, an identified or
identifiable individual.
(8) "Personal data" means information that is linked or reasonably
linkable to an identified or identifiable individual.
(9) "Processing" means any operation or set of operations performed,
whether by manual or automated means, on personal data.
(10) "Processor" means a person that processes personal data on behalf
of a controller.
(11) "Sale" means the exchange of personal data for monetary
consideration by a controller to a third party.
(12) "Sensitive data" means personal data that includes data revealing
racial or ethnic origin, religious beliefs, sexual orientation, or
citizenship or immigration status; processing of genetic or biometric
data; data collected from a known child; or precise geolocation data.
(13) "Targeted advertising" means displaying an advertisement to a
consumer where the advertisement is selected based on personal data
obtained or inferred from the consumer's activities over time and
across nonaffiliated websites or online applications.

articles.title: Applicability
articles.text:
(1) This chapter applies to a person that:
(a) Conducts business in Utah or produces a product or service that is
targeted to consumers who are Utah residents;
(b) Has annual revenue of $25,000,000 or more; and
(c) Satisfies one or more of the following:
(i) During a calendar year, controls or processes personal data of
100,000 or more consumers; or
(ii) Derives over 50% of the entity's gross revenue from the sale of
personal data and controls or processes personal data of 25,000 or
more consumers.
(2) This chapter does not apply to:
(a) A government entity as defined by Section 13-61-101;
(b) A financial institution subject to 15 U.S.C. Section 6801 et seq.;
(c) Protected health information under 45 C.F.R. Parts 160 and 164,
as established pursuant to Public Law 104-191.

articles.title: Consumer rights
articles.text:
(1) A consumer has the right to:
(a) Confirm whether or not a controller is processing the consumer's
personal data and access the personal data;
(b) Delete personal data that the consumer has provided to the
controller;
(c) Obtain a copy of the consumer's personal data that the consumer
previously provided to the controller in a portable and, to the extent
technically feasible, readily usable format; and
(d) Opt out of the processing of the consumer's personal data for
purposes of targeted advertising or the sale of personal data.
(2) A controller shall respond to a consumer request under
Subsection (1) without undue delay, but not later than 45 days after
the day on which the controller receives the consumer's request as
described in Section 13-61-202.

articles.title: Controller response to consumer requests
articles.text:
(1) A controller shall establish a process for a consumer to exercise
the consumer's rights under Section 13-61-201.
(2) A controller may extend the response period by an additional
45 days when reasonably necessary, considering the complexity and
number of the consumer's requests.

articles.title: Controller duties
articles.text:
(1) A controller shall:
(a) Limit the collection of personal data to what is adequate,
relevant, and reasonably necessary in relation to the purposes for
which the data is processed;
(b) Establish, implement, and maintain reasonable administrative,
technical, and physical data security practices to protect the
confidentiality, integrity, and accessibility of personal data.

articles.title: Processor duties
articles.text:
(1) A processor shall adhere to the instructions of the controller
and shall assist the controller in meeting the controller's
obligations under this chapter.

articles.title: Enforcement
articles.text:
(1) The attorney general has exclusive authority to enforce this chapter
pursuant to Section 13-61-402.
(2) The attorney general may bring an action in the name of the state
against a controller or processor that violates this chapter.
